Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a healthy, growing plant with both water and light, accurately representing its living state.
The student can draw wilted or dying plants without water, showing their understanding of the lack of growth without sufficient resources.
The student can draw plants that are not growing well without light, indicating an understanding of the role light plays in plant growth.
The student can include detailed observations showing how both water and light affect plant growth with appropriate labels or notations.
The student can accurately identify and illustrate the differences between healthy plants with adequate resources and those without, making clear distinctions based on their understanding.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally over-simplify the effects of water or light (e.g., drawing extreme scenarios) but generally understands their importance.

The student may omit minor details in labeling or annotations, such as forgetting to label a part of the plant or neglecting a small environmental factor, but this does not detract from overall understanding.
